APC_INDEX_MISMATCH.definition: This indicates a mismatch between the asynchronous procedure call (APC) state index.
APC_INDEX_MISMATCH.solution: Update device drivers, check recently installed software for compatibility, and run a memory diagnostic.

DEVICE_QUEUE_NOT_BUSY.definition: The system attempted a device queue operation while the queue was not busy.
DEVICE_QUEUE_NOT_BUSY.solution: Update device drivers, verify hardware connections, and check for improper system configurations.

INVALID_AFFINITY_SET.definition: An illegal processor affinity mask was set.
INVALID_AFFINITY_SET.solution: Inspect system affinity settings, ensure proper software configurations, and verify that all processors are functioning correctly.

INVALID_DATA_ACCESS_TRAP.definition: This indicates that an invalid data access trap was encountered.
INVALID_DATA_ACCESS_TRAP.solution: Run a memory diagnostic, ensure no corrupt drivers are installed, and check for malware.

INVALID_PROCESS_ATTACH_ATTEMPT.definition: The system attempted to attach an invalid process.
INVALID_PROCESS_ATTACH_ATTEMPT.solution: Verify that installed software and drivers are compatible with the operating system.

INVALID_PROCESS_DETACH_ATTEMPT.definition: This indicates an invalid attempt to detach a process.
INVALID_PROCESS_DETACH_ATTEMPT.solution: Debug software applications for improper process handling and ensure all drivers are up-to-date.

INVALID_SOFTWARE_INTERRUPT.definition: This error occurs when a software interrupt is invalid or improperly triggered.
INVALID_SOFTWARE_INTERRUPT.solution: Ensure all software and drivers are up-to-date. Check for bugs in software that handles interrupts.

IRQL_NOT_DISPATCH_LEVEL.definition: This error occurs when a thread attempts an operation at an invalid IRQL (Interrupt Request Level).
IRQL_NOT_DISPATCH_LEVEL.solution: Analyze drivers for IRQL mismanagement and ensure proper synchronization in kernel-mode code.

IRQL_NOT_GREATER_OR_EQUAL.definition: A higher IRQL was expected for the operation, but the current IRQL is too low.
IRQL_NOT_GREATER_OR_EQUAL.solution: Verify and update drivers. Use debugging tools to identify the source of the IRQL conflict.

IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL.definition: Occurs when a kernel-mode process attempts to access memory it shouldn't at an inappropriate IRQL.
IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL.solution: Update drivers, test RAM for errors, and analyze crash dumps to locate the faulty component.

NO_EXCEPTION_HANDLING_SUPPORT.definition: Indicates that an operation required exception handling, but no handler was available.
NO_EXCEPTION_HANDLING_SUPPORT.solution: Examine application code and ensure all required exception handling mechanisms are implemented correctly.

MAXIMUM_WAIT_OBJECTS_EXCEEDED.definition: The system exceeded the maximum limit of wait objects it can handle simultaneously.
MAXIMUM_WAIT_OBJECTS_EXCEEDED.solution: Optimize multithreaded applications and reduce the number of active threads or handles.

MUTEX_LEVEL_NUMBER_VIOLATION.definition: Occurs when an invalid mutex level number is encountered in kernel mode.
MUTEX_LEVEL_NUMBER_VIOLATION.solution: Debug applications or drivers that involve mutex synchronization to identify issues.

NO_USER_MODE_CONTEXT.definition: The system tried to execute an operation requiring user-mode context, but no such context was available.
NO_USER_MODE_CONTEXT.solution: Check kernel-mode operations and ensure that user-mode context is properly set when required.

SPIN_LOCK_ALREADY_OWNED.definition: A kernel-mode thread attempted to acquire a spin lock that it already owns.
SPIN_LOCK_ALREADY_OWNED.solution: Analyze drivers or kernel code for improper spin lock usage and implement proper lock handling.

SPIN_LOCK_NOT_OWNED.definition: A thread attempted to release a spin lock that it does not own.
SPIN_LOCK_NOT_OWNED.solution: Review driver or kernel code to ensure proper lock acquisition and release sequences.

THREAD_NOT_MUTEX_OWNER.definition: A thread tried to release a mutex that it does not own.
THREAD_NOT_MUTEX_OWNER.solution: Verify correct mutex usage in application or driver code to prevent ownership violations.

TRAP_CAUSE_UNKNOWN.definition: An unknown trap exception occurred that the system could not identify.
TRAP_CAUSE_UNKNOWN.solution: Analyze crash dumps and run hardware diagnostics to identify the source of the trap exception.

EMPTY_THREAD_REAPER_LIST.definition: A thread reaper list operation was attempted, but the list was unexpectedly empty.
EMPTY_THREAD_REAPER_LIST.solution: Inspect thread reaper routines and ensure proper thread lifecycle management.

CREATE_DELETE_LOCK_NOT_LOCKED.definition: The system attempted to create or delete a lock but found it was not properly locked.
CREATE_DELETE_LOCK_NOT_LOCKED.solution: Check the application or driver code for proper lock handling and synchronization mechanisms.

LAST_CHANCE_CALLED_FROM_KMODE.definition: A kernel-mode routine called a 'last chance' routine unexpectedly.
LAST_CHANCE_CALLED_FROM_KMODE.solution: Inspect kernel-mode code for improper handling of error routines and ensure they are invoked correctly.

CID_HANDLE_CREATION.definition: A failure occurred while creating a handle for a Client ID (CID).
CID_HANDLE_CREATION.solution: Review process and thread handle creation routines for potential resource or synchronization issues.

CID_HANDLE_DELETION.definition: A failure occurred while deleting a handle for a Client ID (CID).
CID_HANDLE_DELETION.solution: Ensure proper release of CID-related handles and debug any resource management issues in the code.

REFERENCE_BY_POINTER.definition: An invalid reference count was detected for an object by its pointer.
REFERENCE_BY_POINTER.solution: Examine reference count management in drivers or kernel code to ensure proper object handling.

BAD_POOL_HEADER.definition: A memory pool header corruption was detected in kernel memory.
BAD_POOL_HEADER.solution: Check drivers and memory-intensive programs for bugs, and test system RAM for errors.

MEMORY_MANAGEMENT.definition: This indicates a serious memory management issue, such as corruption or improper allocation.
MEMORY_MANAGEMENT.solution: Analyze crash dumps for memory-related errors and test physical memory for faults.

PFN_SHARE_COUNT.definition: The Page Frame Number (PFN) share count is inconsistent or corrupted.
PFN_SHARE_COUNT.solution: Inspect memory management routines and hardware for errors, especially memory modules.

PFN_REFERENCE_COUNT.definition: The reference count for a Page Frame Number (PFN) is inconsistent or invalid.
PFN_REFERENCE_COUNT.solution: Verify drivers and system memory. Debug memory management issues in kernel-mode code.

NO_SPIN_LOCK_AVAILABLE.definition: A thread attempted to acquire a spin lock, but none was available.
NO_SPIN_LOCK_AVAILABLE.solution: Ensure adequate spin lock availability and proper handling in drivers or kernel code.

KMODE_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED.definition: A kernel-mode exception was not properly handled by the system.
KMODE_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED.solution: Analyze the crash dump to identify the source of the exception and debug kernel code accordingly.

SHARED_RESOURCE_CONV_ERROR.definition: An error occurred while converting shared resources, leading to an inconsistency.
SHARED_RESOURCE_CONV_ERROR.solution: Review resource-sharing mechanisms and debug drivers managing shared resources.

KERNEL_APC_PENDING_DURING_EXIT.definition: An Asynchronous Procedure Call (APC) was pending for a thread exiting kernel mode.
KERNEL_APC_PENDING_DURING_EXIT.solution: Ensure proper synchronization and thread lifecycle management in kernel-mode operations.

QUOTA_UNDERFLOW.definition: The system detected a quota underflow, indicating improper resource allocation.
QUOTA_UNDERFLOW.solution: Debug resource quota management in applications or drivers and ensure correct usage.

FILE_SYSTEM.definition: A critical error occurred in the file system, likely due to corruption or a failed operation.
FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Run a disk check utility (e.g., chkdsk), verify the integrity of file system drivers, and check for hardware issues with storage devices.

FAT_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: A critical error occurred in the FAT file system, likely due to corruption or a driver issue.
FAT_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Run chkdsk on the affected volume, update file system drivers, and check for hardware issues.

NTFS_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: An error occurred in the NTFS file system, potentially due to corruption or improper operations.
NTFS_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Run chkdsk, ensure the integrity of the NTFS volume, and update storage-related drivers.

NPFS_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: An error was detected in the Named Pipe File System driver.
NPFS_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Inspect the named pipe driver (NPFS.sys) for updates or corruption and verify related software.

CDFS_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: A critical error occurred in the CD-ROM File System (CDFS) driver.
CDFS_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Check the CD/DVD media and update or repair the CDFS.sys driver.

RDR_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: An error was detected in the network redirector file system driver.
RDR_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Inspect network-related drivers for corruption or incompatibility and update them if necessary.

CORRUPT_ACCESS_TOKEN.definition: The system detected a corruption in an access token.
CORRUPT_ACCESS_TOKEN.solution: Inspect user authentication processes and update or repair security-related system files.

SECURITY_SYSTEM.definition: A failure occurred in the security subsystem of the operating system.
SECURITY_SYSTEM.solution: Ensure system integrity by checking security logs, running antivirus scans, and verifying system files.

INCONSISTENT_IRP.definition: An inconsistency was detected in an I/O Request Packet (IRP).
INCONSISTENT_IRP.solution: Debug I/O operations and inspect drivers handling IRPs for errors or corruption.

PANIC_STACK_SWITCH.definition: A kernel-mode thread performed an illegal stack switch.
PANIC_STACK_SWITCH.solution: Debug thread stack management and ensure proper context switching in kernel-mode operations.

PORT_DRIVER_INTERNAL.definition: An internal error occurred in a port driver.
PORT_DRIVER_INTERNAL.solution: Update or repair port drivers and check for conflicts or resource management issues.

SCSI_DISK_DRIVER_INTERNAL.definition: An internal error was detected in the SCSI disk driver.
SCSI_DISK_DRIVER_INTERNAL.solution: Inspect and update SCSI-related drivers and verify the health of storage devices.

DATA_BUS_ERROR.definition: A data bus error occurred, potentially caused by faulty hardware or drivers.
DATA_BUS_ERROR.solution: Check system RAM, motherboard, and connected devices for hardware issues.

INSTRUCTION_BUS_ERROR.definition: An error occurred in the instruction bus, typically indicative of hardware failure.
INSTRUCTION_BUS_ERROR.solution: Inspect and test the CPU, memory, and motherboard for faults.

SET_OF_INVALID_CONTEXT.definition: An invalid processor context was detected.
SET_OF_INVALID_CONTEXT.solution: Debug kernel operations and check for driver or hardware-related inconsistencies.

PHASE0_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The system failed during phase 0 of initialization.
PHASE0_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Check boot configuration and hardware initialization logs for errors.

PHASE1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The system failed during phase 1 of initialization.
PHASE1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Verify kernel and driver initialization processes and check for missing or corrupted files.

UNEXPECTED_INITIALIZATION_CALL.definition: A driver made an unexpected call during initialization.
UNEXPECTED_INITIALIZATION_CALL.solution: Inspect drivers for proper initialization routines and debug kernel logs.

CACHE_MANAGER.definition: A critical error occurred in the cache manager subsystem.
CACHE_MANAGER.solution: Update system drivers and check for disk or memory corruption affecting the cache manager.

NO_MORE_IRP_STACK_LOCATIONS.definition: An IRP had no remaining stack locations for a driver to process.
NO_MORE_IRP_STACK_LOCATIONS.solution: Verify driver configurations and debug improper IRP stack usage in kernel-mode code.

DEVICE_REFERENCE_COUNT_NOT_ZERO.definition: A device object had a non-zero reference count when it was deleted.
DEVICE_REFERENCE_COUNT_NOT_ZERO.solution: Inspect driver code for proper reference count handling and resource cleanup.

FLOPPY_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error occurred in the floppy disk driver.
FLOPPY_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Update or repair floppy disk drivers, if applicable, or remove unsupported hardware.

SERIAL_DRIVER_INTERNAL.definition: An internal error was detected in the serial driver.
SERIAL_DRIVER_INTERNAL.solution: Inspect and update serial port drivers, and check for hardware conflicts.

SYSTEM_EXIT_OWNED_MUTEX.definition: A thread exited while still holding a mutex it owned.
SYSTEM_EXIT_OWNED_MUTEX.solution: Debug thread synchronization and ensure proper release of mutexes in code.

SYSTEM_UNWIND_PREVIOUS_USER.definition: An error occurred while unwinding a system call from a user thread.
SYSTEM_UNWIND_PREVIOUS_USER.solution: Inspect thread stack operations and debug user-mode to kernel-mode transitions.

SYSTEM_SERVICE_EXCEPTION.definition: A system service executed an invalid operation, typically due to incorrect memory access.
SYSTEM_SERVICE_EXCEPTION.solution: Check recently installed drivers or software, update Windows, and inspect system logs for further clues.

INTERRUPT_UNWIND_ATTEMPTED.definition: An interrupt attempted to unwind improperly, likely due to faulty interrupt handling.
INTERRUPT_UNWIND_ATTEMPTED.solution: Verify and update interrupt-handling drivers or firmware.

INTERRUPT_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED.definition: An unhandled exception occurred during an interrupt routine.
INTERRUPT_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED.solution: Debug kernel interrupt routines and ensure hardware compatibility with the system.

MULTIPROCESSOR_CONFIGURATION_NOT_SUPPORT.definition: The system does not support the current multiprocessor configuration.
MULTIPROCESSOR_CONFIGURATION_NOT_SUPPORT.solution: Check BIOS/UEFI settings, ensure all CPUs are compatible, and update the firmware.

NO_MORE_SYSTEM_PTES.definition: The system ran out of Page Table Entries (PTEs) for mapping kernel memory.
NO_MORE_SYSTEM_PTES.solution: Increase the number of available PTEs by modifying the system registry or reducing memory-intensive operations.

TARGET_MDL_TOO_SMALL.definition: A Memory Descriptor List (MDL) was too small for the I/O operation requested.
TARGET_MDL_TOO_SMALL.solution: Update or debug drivers using MDLs for I/O operations and ensure they allocate sufficient memory.

MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_EMPTY.definition: A critical pool allocation failed because the must-succeed memory pool was empty.
MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_EMPTY.solution: Investigate and resolve memory leaks, and increase system memory if necessary.

ATDISK_DRIVER_INTERNAL.definition: An internal error occurred in the ATDISK driver.
ATDISK_DRIVER_INTERNAL.solution: Update the ATDISK.sys driver and inspect the associated hardware.

NO_SUCH_PARTITION.definition: A requested partition could not be found during boot or access attempts.
NO_SUCH_PARTITION.solution: Verify the partition table, check disk integrity, and ensure the correct boot device is selected.

MULTIPLE_IRP_COMPLETE_REQUESTS.definition: A driver attempted to complete an IRP that had already been completed.
MULTIPLE_IRP_COMPLETE_REQUESTS.solution: Debug driver behavior and ensure proper handling of IRPs without duplicate completions.

INSUFFICIENT_SYSTEM_MAP_REGS.definition: The system ran out of map registers for DMA operations.
INSUFFICIENT_SYSTEM_MAP_REGS.solution: Optimize DMA usage or modify the system configuration to allocate more map registers.

DEREF_UNKNOWN_LOGON_SESSION.definition: An attempt was made to dereference an unknown logon session.
DEREF_UNKNOWN_LOGON_SESSION.solution: Inspect authentication services and debug security-related modules.

REF_UNKNOWN_LOGON_SESSION.definition: An attempt was made to reference an unknown logon session.
REF_UNKNOWN_LOGON_SESSION.solution: Check authentication and session management processes for errors.

CANCEL_STATE_IN_COMPLETED_IRP.definition: A driver attempted to cancel an IRP that was already completed.
CANCEL_STATE_IN_COMPLETED_IRP.solution: Debug driver handling of IRPs and ensure proper state tracking.

PAGE_FAULT_WITH_INTERRUPTS_OFF.definition: A page fault occurred while interrupts were disabled.
PAGE_FAULT_WITH_INTERRUPTS_OFF.solution: Inspect kernel code for invalid memory access during critical sections.

IRQL_GT_ZERO_AT_SYSTEM_SERVICE.definition: A system service call was made at an IRQL higher than zero, which is invalid.
IRQL_GT_ZERO_AT_SYSTEM_SERVICE.solution: Debug driver IRQL levels and inspect kernel-mode operations for violations.

STREAMS_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error occurred in the STREAMS subsystem.
STREAMS_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Inspect STREAMS-based drivers and update or debug them as necessary.

FATAL_UNHANDLED_HARD_ERROR.definition: A fatal, unhandled error occurred during hardware interaction.
FATAL_UNHANDLED_HARD_ERROR.solution: Check system logs for hardware failure details and update drivers or firmware.

NO_PAGES_AVAILABLE.definition: The system ran out of available pages in memory.
NO_PAGES_AVAILABLE.solution: Increase system RAM or optimize memory usage.

PFN_LIST_CORRUPT.definition: The Page Frame Number (PFN) list was corrupted.
PFN_LIST_CORRUPT.solution: Run memory diagnostics and inspect drivers interacting with memory management.

NDIS_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error occurred in the NDIS (Network Driver Interface Specification) driver.
NDIS_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Inspect and update network drivers for compatibility and stability.

PAGE_FAULT_IN_NONPAGED_AREA.definition: An attempt was made to access memory in the non-paged area, causing a fault.
PAGE_FAULT_IN_NONPAGED_AREA.solution: Run memory diagnostics, check recently installed drivers, and inspect hardware for faults.

REGISTRY_ERROR.definition: A critical error occurred in the Windows Registry.
REGISTRY_ERROR.solution: Restore the registry from a backup, repair the registry, or reinstall the operating system if necessary.

MAILSLOT_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: An error was detected in the Mailslot File System.
MAILSLOT_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Inspect and update related drivers or software interacting with the mailslot system.

NO_BOOT_DEVICE.definition: The system could not locate a boot device during startup.
NO_BOOT_DEVICE.solution: Verify boot configuration, check connections to boot devices, and repair boot sectors if needed.

LM_SERVER_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error occurred in the LAN Manager server.
LM_SERVER_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Inspect LAN Manager configuration and update associated drivers or services.

DATA_COHERENCY_EXCEPTION.definition: A data coherency exception was detected, often caused by faulty hardware or driver issues.
DATA_COHERENCY_EXCEPTION.solution: Test hardware components and ensure drivers maintain data integrity.

INSTRUCTION_COHERENCY_EXCEPTION.definition: An instruction coherency exception occurred, potentially due to hardware failure.
INSTRUCTION_COHERENCY_EXCEPTION.solution: Inspect CPU and memory components for faults and update firmware if necessary.

XNS_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error was detected in the Xerox Network Systems (XNS) protocol driver.
XNS_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Update or debug XNS-related drivers or replace legacy protocols with modern alternatives.

FTDISK_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error occurred in the FTDISK driver, responsible for fault-tolerant disk operations.
FTDISK_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Update or repair the FTDISK driver, and check the integrity of fault-tolerant disk configurations.

PINBALL_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: An error was detected in the Pinball file system, typically used for removable media.
PINBALL_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Check the health of removable storage devices and update related file system drivers.

CRITICAL_SERVICE_FAILED.definition: A critical system service failed to start during boot.
CRITICAL_SERVICE_FAILED.solution: Identify the failing service in system logs and repair or reinstall the associated application or driver.

SET_ENV_VAR_FAILED.definition: The system encountered an error while setting an environment variable.
SET_ENV_VAR_FAILED.solution: Verify the environment variables and check for corrupt system files using tools like SFC.

HAL_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL) failed to initialize during startup.
HAL_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Ensure compatibility between the operating system and hardware. Update the BIOS/UEFI and HAL drivers.

UNSUPPORTED_PROCESSOR.definition: The processor is unsupported by the current version of Windows.
UNSUPPORTED_PROCESSOR.solution: Verify the system requirements and ensure the processor is compatible with the installed operating system version.

OBJECT_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: An object manager failed to initialize a system object.
OBJECT_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Inspect system logs for detailed errors, repair system files, or reinstall the operating system if necessary.

SECURITY_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The security subsystem failed to initialize.
SECURITY_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Check system logs for security-related errors and repair or update the operating system.

PROCESS_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The system process manager failed to initialize a critical process.
PROCESS_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Inspect system logs for process-specific errors and perform a system repair or restore.

HAL1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: An alternative Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL1) failed to initialize.
HAL1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Verify the correct HAL version is installed and compatible with the hardware configuration.

OBJECT1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: An object manager encountered a critical error during initialization.
OBJECT1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Inspect system logs, repair system files, and ensure system integrity.

SECURITY1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: An alternate security subsystem failed to initialize during boot.
SECURITY1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Update or repair security drivers and subsystems. Check for incompatible third-party security software.

SYMBOLIC_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: A symbolic link-related initialization process failed.
SYMBOLIC_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Verify symbolic link configurations and inspect filesystem integrity.

MEMORY1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: A failure occurred during the initialization of a memory management component.
MEMORY1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Run memory diagnostics and repair system files as needed.

CACHE_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The system cache manager failed to initialize during startup.
CACHE_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Inspect disk and memory subsystems, and repair or update associated drivers.

CONFIG_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The configuration manager failed to initialize system settings.
CONFIG_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Repair the system configuration using recovery tools or reinstall the operating system.

FILE_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: A critical error occurred during the initialization of file management components.
FILE_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Check disk integrity, repair filesystem errors, and ensure system file integrity.

IO1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The I/O manager failed to initialize during boot.
IO1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Inspect system logs for I/O-related errors and update or repair drivers.

LPC_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The Local Procedure Call (LPC) subsystem failed to initialize.
LPC_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Check system logs and ensure the LPC manager and related drivers are functioning correctly.

PROCESS1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: An alternate process manager failed to initialize during startup.
PROCESS1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Inspect and repair process initialization components in the operating system.

REFMON_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The reference monitor failed to initialize, potentially causing security issues.
REFMON_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Update or repair security subsystems and inspect system integrity.

SESSION1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: An error occurred during the initialization of session management components.
SESSION1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Check session-related system logs and repair or update the operating system.

SESSION2_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: An alternate session management process failed during startup.
SESSION2_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Inspect and repair session management subsystems.

SESSION3_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: A critical error occurred in session management during the system boot process.
SESSION3_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Debug session-related errors and ensure the integrity of system files.

SESSION4_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: Another session initialization component failed to load.
SESSION4_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Check logs for session management issues and repair system files.

SESSION5_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: A failure occurred during the initialization of a specific session-related component.
SESSION5_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Ensure session components are correctly configured and up-to-date.

ASSIGN_DRIVE_LETTERS_FAILED.definition: The system failed to assign drive letters during initialization.
ASSIGN_DRIVE_LETTERS_FAILED.solution: Inspect disk management settings and ensure all drives are correctly configured.

CONFIG_LIST_FAILED.definition: The configuration manager failed to allocate or process a configuration list.
CONFIG_LIST_FAILED.solution: Run system diagnostics, repair the registry, or restore from a backup.

BAD_SYSTEM_CONFIG_INFO.definition: The system configuration is corrupt or incompatible.
BAD_SYSTEM_CONFIG_INFO.solution: Check for hardware issues, restore the registry, or perform a system repair.

CANNOT_WRITE_CONFIGURATION.definition: The system was unable to write configuration information to storage.
CANNOT_WRITE_CONFIGURATION.solution: Check disk integrity, repair the registry, or free up disk space.

PROCESS_HAS_LOCKED_PAGES.definition: A process has locked memory pages that were not properly unlocked.
PROCESS_HAS_LOCKED_PAGES.solution: Identify and troubleshoot the faulty driver or process using memory debugging tools.

KERNEL_STACK_INPAGE_ERROR.definition: The system was unable to retrieve a page of kernel data from the paging file.
KERNEL_STACK_INPAGE_ERROR.solution: Check for disk errors, bad sectors, or failing storage devices. Run chkdsk and memory diagnostics.

PHASE0_EXCEPTION.definition: An exception occurred during the initial boot phase (Phase 0).
PHASE0_EXCEPTION.solution: Verify the integrity of boot files and hardware components.

MISMATCHED_HAL.definition: The installed Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL) does not match the system hardware.
MISMATCHED_HAL.solution: Install the correct HAL version or reinstall the operating system.

KERNEL_DATA_INPAGE_ERROR.definition: The requested page of kernel data could not be read from the paging file into memory.
KERNEL_DATA_INPAGE_ERROR.solution: Run disk and memory diagnostics to check for hardware failures or corrupt files.

INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE.definition: The system failed to access the boot device during startup.
INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE.solution: Check boot order in BIOS/UEFI, repair the bootloader, or verify the storage device connection.

BUGCODE_NDIS_DRIVER.definition: An error occurred in a Network Driver Interface Specification (NDIS) driver.
BUGCODE_NDIS_DRIVER.solution: Update or rollback the NDIS driver and check for network hardware compatibility.

INSTALL_MORE_MEMORY.definition: The system does not have enough memory to run the required processes.
INSTALL_MORE_MEMORY.solution: Upgrade the system's physical memory (RAM) or optimize resource usage.

SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED.definition: A system thread caused an unhandled exception.
SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED.solution: Check for driver updates or rollbacks, and analyze crash dump files for the faulty module.

UNEXPECTED_KERNEL_MODE_TRAP.definition: The kernel encountered an unexpected trap condition.
UNEXPECTED_KERNEL_MODE_TRAP.solution: Inspect for hardware issues (RAM, CPU, or motherboard), and verify driver integrity.

NMI_HARDWARE_FAILURE.definition: A hardware malfunction triggered a non-maskable interrupt (NMI).
NMI_HARDWARE_FAILURE.solution: Test hardware components, especially memory and CPU, for stability and failures.

SPIN_LOCK_INIT_FAILURE.definition: A failure occurred during the initialization of a spin lock.
SPIN_LOCK_INIT_FAILURE.solution: Debug the system initialization process and verify hardware and driver compatibility.

DFS_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: An error was detected in the Distributed File System (DFS).
DFS_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Check DFS configurations, update related drivers, and verify file system integrity.

SETUP_FAILURE.definition: A failure occurred during the system setup process.
SETUP_FAILURE.solution: Reattempt the setup process, verify installation media integrity, or check hardware compatibility.

MBR_CHECKSUM_MISMATCH.definition: The Master Boot Record (MBR) checksum does not match the expected value.
MBR_CHECKSUM_MISMATCH.solution: Repair or recreate the MBR using recovery tools like Bootrec or a fresh OS installation.

KERNEL_MODE_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED.definition: A kernel-mode program generated an exception that the error handler did not catch.
KERNEL_MODE_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED.solution: Analyze the crash dump for faulty drivers or memory issues.

PP0_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The system's preprocessor failed to initialize (Phase 0).
PP0_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Verify system file integrity and troubleshoot the boot process.

PP1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The system's preprocessor failed to initialize (Phase 1).
PP1_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Inspect the system logs for specific errors and restore or repair system files.

UP_DRIVER_ON_MP_SYSTEM.definition: A uniprocessor (UP) driver was loaded on a multiprocessor (MP) system.
UP_DRIVER_ON_MP_SYSTEM.solution: Install the correct driver for multiprocessor systems or configure the system appropriately.

INVALID_KERNEL_HANDLE.definition: A driver or program accessed an invalid kernel handle.
INVALID_KERNEL_HANDLE.solution: Debug the driver or application and check for improper kernel API usage.

KERNEL_STACK_LOCKED_AT_EXIT.definition: A driver or process did not properly unlock the kernel stack during exit.
KERNEL_STACK_LOCKED_AT_EXIT.solution: Identify the faulty driver or application and debug for resource management issues.

INVALID_WORK_QUEUE_ITEM.definition: A driver queued an invalid work item.
INVALID_WORK_QUEUE_ITEM.solution: Update or debug the faulty driver to resolve the invalid queueing behavior.

BOUND_IMAGE_UNSUPPORTED.definition: The system attempted to load a bound image that is unsupported.
BOUND_IMAGE_UNSUPPORTED.solution: Ensure that all drivers and system files are compatible with the current operating system.

END_OF_NT_EVALUATION_PERIOD.definition: The evaluation period for the version of Windows has expired.
END_OF_NT_EVALUATION_PERIOD.solution: Upgrade to a licensed version of Windows or reactivate the operating system with a valid product key.

INVALID_REGION_OR_SEGMENT.definition: A process accessed an invalid memory region or segment.
INVALID_REGION_OR_SEGMENT.solution: Analyze memory allocations in the application or driver causing the issue and ensure proper pointer usage.

SYSTEM_LICENSE_VIOLATION.definition: The system detected a violation in the licensing terms or activation.
SYSTEM_LICENSE_VIOLATION.solution: Revalidate the system license with the correct product key or contact Microsoft support for assistance.

UDFS_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: An error occurred in the Universal Disk File System (UDFS).
UDFS_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Check the UDFS storage device for corruption and update drivers for the optical or removable storage.

MACHINE_CHECK_EXCEPTION.definition: A hardware error occurred, often related to the CPU or memory.
MACHINE_CHECK_EXCEPTION.solution: Check for overheating, run hardware diagnostics, and ensure components are securely seated and functioning correctly.

USER_MODE_HEALTH_MONITOR.definition: The user-mode health monitoring system detected a problem with a critical process.
USER_MODE_HEALTH_MONITOR.solution: Check for failing applications, corrupted system files, or rogue processes. Use Event Viewer for details.

DRIVER_POWER_STATE_FAILURE.definition: A driver failed to change its power state properly.
DRIVER_POWER_STATE_FAILURE.solution: Update or rollback device drivers, particularly for power-related components like GPUs or network adapters.

INTERNAL_POWER_ERROR.definition: A critical internal power management error occurred.
INTERNAL_POWER_ERROR.solution: Check power supply settings, ensure proper driver installation, and troubleshoot hibernation or sleep configurations.

PCI_BUS_DRIVER_INTERNAL.definition: The PCI bus driver encountered an internal error.
PCI_BUS_DRIVER_INTERNAL.solution: Update chipset or PCI bus drivers, and verify the integrity of connected hardware devices.

MEMORY_IMAGE_CORRUPT.definition: A memory dump image is corrupted or unreadable.
MEMORY_IMAGE_CORRUPT.solution: Verify system memory for errors and ensure proper configuration for creating memory dumps.

ACPI_DRIVER_INTERNAL.definition: The ACPI driver encountered an internal issue.
ACPI_DRIVER_INTERNAL.solution: Update the BIOS/UEFI and ensure all ACPI-compliant drivers are correctly installed.

CNSS_FILE_SYSTEM_FILTER.definition: An error occurred in the CNSS file system filter.
CNSS_FILE_SYSTEM_FILTER.solution: Check the associated file system filter drivers and update or remove third-party software.

ACPI_BIOS_ERROR.definition: The ACPI BIOS is not compliant with ACPI specifications.
ACPI_BIOS_ERROR.solution: Update the BIOS/UEFI firmware and verify hardware compatibility.

BAD_EXHANDLE.definition: A program or driver passed a bad handle to an executive routine.
BAD_EXHANDLE.solution: Debug the application or driver, and check for proper handle usage and cleanup.

HAL_MEMORY_ALLOCATION.definition: The Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL) failed to allocate necessary memory.
HAL_MEMORY_ALLOCATION.solution: Inspect hardware configuration and ensure adequate system resources are available.

VIDEO_DRIVER_DEBUG_REPORT_REQUEST.definition: The video driver requested a debug report for troubleshooting purposes.
VIDEO_DRIVER_DEBUG_REPORT_REQUEST.solution: Check for updates to the video driver and analyze the generated debug report for details.

BGI_DETECTED_VIOLATION.definition: The Boot Graphics Input (BGI) system detected a violation.
BGI_DETECTED_VIOLATION.solution: Update graphics drivers and troubleshoot boot graphics-related components.

VIDEO_DRIVER_INIT_FAILURE.definition: The video driver failed to initialize properly.
VIDEO_DRIVER_INIT_FAILURE.solution: Reinstall or update the video driver, and verify GPU hardware functionality.

ATTEMPTED_SWITCH_FROM_DPC.definition: A Direct Process Call (DPC) routine attempted to switch to another thread improperly.
ATTEMPTED_SWITCH_FROM_DPC.solution: Analyze drivers for improper thread handling and update or debug the affected driver.

CHIPSET_DETECTED_ERROR.definition: An error occurred in the system's chipset.
CHIPSET_DETECTED_ERROR.solution: Update chipset drivers and ensure proper hardware configuration.

SESSION_HAS_VALID_VIEWS_ON_EXIT.definition: A session had active views remaining during exit.
SESSION_HAS_VALID_VIEWS_ON_EXIT.solution: Troubleshoot session handling in drivers or applications and resolve resource cleanup issues.

NETWORK_BOOT_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The system failed to initialize a network boot.
NETWORK_BOOT_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Verify network boot settings in BIOS/UEFI and ensure network infrastructure is properly configured.

NETWORK_BOOT_DUPLICATE_ADDRESS.definition: A duplicate IP address was detected during a network boot.
NETWORK_BOOT_DUPLICATE_ADDRESS.solution: Resolve IP conflicts in the network and reconfigure DHCP or static IP settings.

INVALID_HIBERNATED_STATE.definition: The system encountered an invalid state while resuming from hibernation.
INVALID_HIBERNATED_STATE.solution: Delete the hibernation file and re-enable hibernation settings if necessary.

ATTEMPTED_WRITE_TO_READONLY_MEMORY.definition: A driver attempted to write to a read-only memory segment.
ATTEMPTED_WRITE_TO_READONLY_MEMORY.solution: Update or debug the offending driver and ensure memory protection mechanisms are respected.

MUTEX_ALREADY_OWNED.definition: A mutex was already owned by a thread attempting to acquire it again.
MUTEX_ALREADY_OWNED.solution: Analyze the application's or driver's mutex handling logic for deadlocks or misuse.

SPECIAL_POOL_DETECTED_MEMORY_CORRUPTION.definition: Special pool detected memory corruption, often due to a driver issue.
SPECIAL_POOL_DETECTED_MEMORY_CORRUPTION.solution: Enable Driver Verifier to identify the faulty driver and update or replace it.

BAD_POOL_CALLER.definition: A process or driver made an invalid pool request.
BAD_POOL_CALLER.solution: Debug the driver or process causing the error and ensure valid memory management operations.

DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION.definition: Driver Verifier detected a violation in a driver.
DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION.solution: Analyze the crash dump file and update or debug the offending driver.

DRIVER_CORRUPTED_EXPOOL.definition: A driver corrupted the system's extended pool.
DRIVER_CORRUPTED_EXPOOL.solution: Enable Driver Verifier to identify the problematic driver and debug or replace it.

DRIVER_CAUGHT_MODIFYING_FREED_POOL.definition: A driver attempted to modify memory that was already freed.
DRIVER_CAUGHT_MODIFYING_FREED_POOL.solution: Inspect and debug the offending driver for proper memory handling.

TIMER_OR_DPC_INVALID.definition: A timer or Deferred Procedure Call (DPC) was invalid.
TIMER_OR_DPC_INVALID.solution: Check for driver-related DPC issues and update or debug affected drivers.

IRQL_UNEXPECTED_VALUE.definition: An unexpected interrupt request level (IRQL) was encountered.
IRQL_UNEXPECTED_VALUE.solution: Inspect interrupt handling in drivers and ensure proper IRQL transitions.

DRIVER_VERIFIER_IOMANAGER_VIOLATION.definition: Driver Verifier detected a violation in the I/O Manager operations.
DRIVER_VERIFIER_IOMANAGER_VIOLATION.solution: Analyze the crash dump file to identify the offending driver, update or replace the driver, and test the system without Driver Verifier enabled.

PNP_DETECTED_FATAL_ERROR.definition: A fatal error occurred in the Plug and Play (PnP) system, often caused by driver or hardware issues.
PNP_DETECTED_FATAL_ERROR.solution: Check the PnP-related drivers and update them. If recent hardware changes were made, verify compatibility and reseat the hardware components.

DRIVER_LEFT_LOCKED_PAGES_IN_PROCESS.definition: A driver failed to release locked memory pages, leading to a resource leak.
DRIVER_LEFT_LOCKED_PAGES_IN_PROCESS.solution: Identify the faulty driver using memory dump analysis tools, update or reinstall the driver, and run a full system diagnostic.

PAGE_FAULT_IN_FREED_SPECIAL_POOL.definition: A page fault occurred in a memory area that was already freed, typically caused by a buggy driver.
PAGE_FAULT_IN_FREED_SPECIAL_POOL.solution: Run Driver Verifier to detect the problematic driver and replace or update it. Use memory debugging tools to verify consistency.

PAGE_FAULT_BEYOND_END_OF_ALLOCATION.definition: A page fault occurred in an invalid memory region beyond the allocation boundary.
PAGE_FAULT_BEYOND_END_OF_ALLOCATION.solution: Use debugging tools to identify the faulty driver or application. Check for buffer overflows or memory mismanagement in system logs.

DRIVER_UNLOADED_WITHOUT_CANCELLING_PENDI.definition: A driver was unloaded while pending operations were not canceled, leading to system instability.
DRIVER_UNLOADED_WITHOUT_CANCELLING_PENDI.solution: Enable Driver Verifier to identify the driver, review its unloading routine, and replace it with an updated version.

TERMINAL_SERVER_DRIVER_MADE_INCORRECT_ME.definition: A Terminal Server driver referenced invalid memory, leading to an exception.
TERMINAL_SERVER_DRIVER_MADE_INCORRECT_ME.solution: Check and update Terminal Server-related drivers and configurations. Ensure compatibility with the system version.

DRIVER_CORRUPTED_MMPOOL.definition: A driver caused corruption in the memory management pool.
DRIVER_CORRUPTED_MMPOOL.solution: Run Driver Verifier, locate the problematic driver, and update or replace it. Check for memory hardware errors.

DRIVER_IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL.definition: A driver accessed invalid memory while at an incorrect IRQL level.
DRIVER_IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL.solution: Use debugging tools to find the offending driver, update or reinstall it, and ensure correct hardware configurations.

BUGCODE_ID_DRIVER.definition: A driver error related to input device operations.
BUGCODE_ID_DRIVER.solution: Verify the input device driver and update it. Run diagnostic tools for input-related issues.

DRIVER_PORTION_MUST_BE_NONPAGED.definition: A driver referenced memory that was paged out while it should have been non-paged.
DRIVER_PORTION_MUST_BE_NONPAGED.solution: Identify the faulty driver using the crash dump file and replace it with a properly functioning version.

SYSTEM_SCAN_AT_RAISED_IRQL_CAUGHT_IMPROP.definition: A driver was unloaded while the system was scanning for IRQL levels, violating protocol.
SYSTEM_SCAN_AT_RAISED_IRQL_CAUGHT_IMPROP.solution: Analyze the crash dump for driver details, update the driver, and ensure proper unload routines are implemented.

DRIVER_PAGE_FAULT_IN_FREED_SPECIAL_POOL.definition: A driver attempted to access memory in a freed special pool region.
DRIVER_PAGE_FAULT_IN_FREED_SPECIAL_POOL.solution: Enable Driver Verifier to catch the issue during runtime and update the offending driver.

DRIVER_PAGE_FAULT_BEYOND_END_OF_ALLOCATI.definition: A driver accessed a memory region beyond the allocated bounds.
DRIVER_PAGE_FAULT_BEYOND_END_OF_ALLOCATI.solution: Locate the driver using debugging tools, review its memory operations, and update it.

DRIVER_UNMAPPING_INVALID_VIEW.definition: A driver tried to unmap a memory view that was invalid or not mapped.
DRIVER_UNMAPPING_INVALID_VIEW.solution: Review the driver code or update the driver. Use memory debugging tools to trace unmapping calls.

DRIVER_USED_EXCESSIVE_PTES.definition: A driver exhausted the system's page table entries (PTEs).
DRIVER_USED_EXCESSIVE_PTES.solution: Analyze system PTE usage and check for excessive memory allocation by drivers. Update drivers if needed.

LOCKED_PAGES_TRACKER_CORRUPTION.definition: The locked pages tracker detected corruption in its records.
LOCKED_PAGES_TRACKER_CORRUPTION.solution: Enable Driver Verifier to track locked pages and identify the driver responsible. Update or replace the driver.

SYSTEM_PTE_MISUSE.definition: A driver misused system PTEs, causing corruption or resource exhaustion.
SYSTEM_PTE_MISUSE.solution: Examine the driver responsible using debugging tools and update or replace it.

DRIVER_CORRUPTED_SYSPTES.definition: A driver caused corruption in the system page table entries (PTEs).
DRIVER_CORRUPTED_SYSPTES.solution: Run Driver Verifier, update the offending driver, and analyze system memory configurations.

DRIVER_INVALID_STACK_ACCESS.definition: A driver accessed the stack in an invalid way, causing corruption or exceptions.
DRIVER_INVALID_STACK_ACCESS.solution: Identify and update the faulty driver using debugging tools. Review driver stack operations.

POOL_CORRUPTION_IN_FILE_AREA.definition: Corruption was detected in a pool area related to file operations.
POOL_CORRUPTION_IN_FILE_AREA.solution: Enable Driver Verifier and inspect recent driver installations or updates related to file handling.

IMPERSONATING_WORKER_THREAD.definition: A worker thread tried to impersonate improperly, causing security violations.
IMPERSONATING_WORKER_THREAD.solution: Inspect thread handling in drivers or applications, update the faulty driver, and review impersonation routines.

ACPI_BIOS_FATAL_ERROR.definition: An ACPI BIOS error occurred due to incompatibility or corruption.
ACPI_BIOS_FATAL_ERROR.solution: Update the BIOS to the latest version and ensure system drivers are ACPI-compliant.

WORKER_THREAD_RETURNED_AT_BAD_IRQL.definition: A worker thread returned to the system at an incorrect IRQL level.
WORKER_THREAD_RETURNED_AT_BAD_IRQL.solution: Update the driver responsible for managing worker threads. Use debugging tools for detailed analysis.

MANUALLY_INITIATED_CRASH.definition: A manual crash was initiated for debugging purposes.
MANUALLY_INITIATED_CRASH.solution: Analyze the crash dump and logs to diagnose the issue causing the manual initiation.

RESOURCE_NOT_OWNED.definition: A thread attempted to release a resource it did not own.
RESOURCE_NOT_OWNED.solution: Check recent driver or application changes. Use debugging tools to identify the source of the error.

WORKER_INVALID.definition: An invalid worker thread operation was detected.
WORKER_INVALID.solution: Analyze the thread creation and termination routines in drivers. Update any faulty drivers.

DRIVER_VERIFIER_DMA_VIOLATION.definition: Driver Verifier detected a violation in DMA operations.
DRIVER_VERIFIER_DMA_VIOLATION.solution: Update the faulty driver identified by Driver Verifier. Verify DMA settings and compatibility.

INVALID_FLOATING_POINT_STATE.definition: The system encountered an invalid floating point state, usually caused by faulty hardware or software attempting to execute floating point operations incorrectly.
INVALID_FLOATING_POINT_STATE.solution: Check for faulty hardware (especially the CPU), update drivers, and ensure that the software running is compatible with the system’s hardware.

INVALID_CANCEL_OF_FILE_OPEN.definition: An invalid cancellation of a file open operation occurred, often due to a driver or file system error.
INVALID_CANCEL_OF_FILE_OPEN.solution: Ensure all drivers, especially disk and file system drivers, are updated. Run a file system check and verify no conflicts in I/O operations.

ACTIVE_EX_WORKER_THREAD_TERMINATION.definition: The system detected the termination of an active EX worker thread, which can result in data corruption or system instability.
ACTIVE_EX_WORKER_THREAD_TERMINATION.solution: Check for driver or hardware issues related to worker thread management. Ensure the system is free of corrupted system files or memory errors.

THREAD_STUCK_IN_DEVICE_DRIVER.definition: A thread in the device driver was stuck, typically due to a malfunctioning driver or a hardware conflict.
THREAD_STUCK_IN_DEVICE_DRIVER.solution: Update the drivers, particularly for graphics and network devices. If the issue persists, test the hardware components for failure.

DIRTY_MAPPED_PAGES_CONGESTION.definition: The system encountered congestion due to dirty mapped pages, typically related to memory or storage issues.
DIRTY_MAPPED_PAGES_CONGESTION.solution: Check for disk space issues, run memory diagnostics, and ensure that memory is properly allocated and managed.

SESSION_HAS_VALID_SPECIAL_POOL_ON_EXIT.definition: The system detected a session exit with a valid special pool, leading to memory corruption or instability.
SESSION_HAS_VALID_SPECIAL_POOL_ON_EXIT.solution: Ensure the system is free of memory corruption, and check for driver issues or improper handling of special pools.

UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME.definition: The boot volume could not be mounted, which can occur due to disk corruption or file system issues.
UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME.solution: Run a disk check (chkdsk) and check the file system for corruption. Repair the boot volume if necessary.

CRITICAL_PROCESS_DIED.definition: A critical system process has unexpectedly terminated, preventing the system from functioning correctly.
CRITICAL_PROCESS_DIED.solution: Restore the system from a backup, run system repair tools, or reinstall the operating system.

STORAGE_MINIPORT_ERROR.definition: The storage miniport driver encountered an error, typically due to hardware failure or driver corruption.
STORAGE_MINIPORT_ERROR.solution: Update the storage driver, check the hardware for defects, and ensure that the system's storage configuration is correct.

SCSI_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION.definition: A violation was detected by the SCSI verifier, possibly related to incorrect or corrupted storage operations.
SCSI_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION.solution: Update the SCSI drivers, check for hardware issues, and disable the SCSI verifier if it's not necessary for troubleshooting.

HARDWARE_INTERRUPT_STORM.definition: A hardware interrupt storm occurred, typically due to faulty hardware or incorrect configuration.
HARDWARE_INTERRUPT_STORM.solution: Check hardware components for defects, ensure that interrupt requests are properly configured, and update related drivers.

DISORDERLY_SHUTDOWN.definition: The system experienced an improper shutdown, which could indicate issues with hardware or power supply.
DISORDERLY_SHUTDOWN.solution: Ensure that power settings are correct, check for hardware failure, and update drivers to prevent improper shutdowns.

CRITICAL_OBJECT_TERMINATION.definition: A critical system object or resource was unexpectedly terminated, causing instability.
CRITICAL_OBJECT_TERMINATION.solution: Check event logs for specific errors, and ensure critical system files are intact. Restore the system if necessary.

FLTMGR_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: An error occurred with the filter manager of the file system, which might indicate file system corruption.
FLTMGR_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Run disk check utilities (chkdsk) and verify that the file system drivers are updated and correctly configured.

PCI_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION.definition: A violation was detected by the PCI verifier, typically indicating a misconfigured or malfunctioning PCI device.
PCI_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION.solution: Update or reinstall PCI drivers, check hardware compatibility, and resolve any conflicts between PCI devices.

DRIVER_OVERRAN_STACK_BUFFER.definition: A driver overran a stack buffer, which may lead to data corruption or instability.
DRIVER_OVERRAN_STACK_BUFFER.solution: Update drivers, check for buffer overflows, and ensure proper memory handling in driver code.

RAMDISK_BOOT_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The RAM disk failed to initialize during boot, which could be related to a configuration or driver issue.
RAMDISK_BOOT_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Verify RAM disk configuration, ensure enough memory is available, and check for related driver updates.

DRIVER_RETURNED_STATUS_REPARSE_FOR_VOLUM.definition: A driver returned an incorrect status during the opening of a volume, leading to instability.
DRIVER_RETURNED_STATUS_REPARSE_FOR_VOLUM.solution: Ensure the file system drivers are up to date and that no incompatible software is installed.

HTTP_DRIVER_CORRUPTED.definition: A corruption occurred in the HTTP driver, potentially caused by a bad update or conflict with other network drivers.
HTTP_DRIVER_CORRUPTED.solution: Reinstall or update network-related drivers, and ensure there are no conflicts in the HTTP configuration.

ATTEMPTED_EXECUTE_OF_NOEXECUTE_MEMORY.definition: The system attempted to execute code from a memory page marked as non-executable, leading to a crash.
ATTEMPTED_EXECUTE_OF_NOEXECUTE_MEMORY.solution: Check for malware or unauthorized software attempting to execute from protected areas. Run memory diagnostics and security scans.

DIRTY_NOWRITE_PAGES_CONGESTION.definition: The system encountered congestion due to dirty pages that could not be written to memory, leading to instability.
DIRTY_NOWRITE_PAGES_CONGESTION.solution: Run disk cleanup, free up space, and check for issues with memory paging and storage systems.

BUGCODE_USB_DRIVER.definition: A USB driver caused an error, which might be due to hardware failure, outdated drivers, or configuration issues.
BUGCODE_USB_DRIVER.solution: Update or reinstall USB drivers, check USB hardware for malfunctions, and ensure that USB ports are configured correctly.

RESERVE_QUEUE_OVERFLOW.definition: The system encountered a reserve queue overflow, typically related to issues with memory or device communication.
RESERVE_QUEUE_OVERFLOW.solution: Check memory settings, increase system resources, and verify device drivers for correct queue management.

LOADER_BLOCK_MISMATCH.definition: A mismatch was detected in the loader block, potentially due to corrupted boot data or a misconfigured boot manager.
LOADER_BLOCK_MISMATCH.solution: Run boot repair utilities, check boot configuration, and restore system from a backup if necessary.

CLOCK_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT.definition: The processor failed to respond within a certain time frame, which may indicate hardware issues.
CLOCK_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT.solution: Check CPU and memory for hardware defects, and ensure that system power and clock settings are correct.

DPC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT.definition: A Deferred Procedure Call (DPC) took too long to complete, causing a timeout.
DPC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT.solution: Update drivers, especially for devices like graphics and network adapters, and check for hardware issues.

MUP_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: An error occurred with the Multiple UNC Provider (MUP) file system driver, which is responsible for accessing network files.
MUP_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Update file system drivers and check network configurations for issues that could interfere with file system operations.

AGP_INVALID_ACCESS.definition: An invalid access error occurred in the Accelerated Graphics Port (AGP) system, typically caused by faulty hardware or driver conflicts.
AGP_INVALID_ACCESS.solution: Check for hardware issues with the GPU, and ensure that the correct drivers for the graphics card and chipset are installed.

AGP_GART_CORRUPTION.definition: The Graphics Address Remapping Table (GART) in the AGP system became corrupted, causing instability.
AGP_GART_CORRUPTION.solution: Update the GPU drivers, check for faulty RAM or hardware, and ensure that the AGP configuration is correct.

AGP_ILLEGALLY_REPROGRAMMED.definition: The AGP configuration was reprogrammed in an illegal manner, typically by a driver or application.
AGP_ILLEGALLY_REPROGRAMMED.solution: Update graphics drivers, check for system overclocking issues, and ensure the GPU is functioning correctly.

THIRD_PARTY_FILE_SYSTEM_FAILURE.definition: A third-party file system driver caused a failure, which may be due to incompatibilities or corruption.
THIRD_PARTY_FILE_SYSTEM_FAILURE.solution: Uninstall or update third-party file system drivers and ensure system files are intact.

CRITICAL_STRUCTURE_CORRUPTION.definition: Critical system structures have become corrupted, often due to hardware failure or data corruption.
CRITICAL_STRUCTURE_CORRUPTION.solution: Run hardware diagnostics, check for memory issues, and verify system integrity with built-in repair tools.

APP_TAGGING_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The system failed to initialize application tagging, possibly due to an issue with the tag manager or system configuration.
APP_TAGGING_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Check system configuration and ensure that application tagging is set up correctly.

FSRTL_EXTRA_CREATE_PARAMETER_VIOLATION.definition: A violation occurred while processing file system operations, specifically related to the extra create parameters.
FSRTL_EXTRA_CREATE_PARAMETER_VIOLATION.solution: Update file system drivers and check for inconsistencies in the system file configuration.

WDF_VIOLATION.definition: A violation occurred within the Windows Driver Framework (WDF), typically due to faulty drivers or conflicts.
WDF_VIOLATION.solution: Update drivers that use the Windows Driver Framework, and check for system conflicts.

VIDEO_MEMORY_MANAGEMENT_INTERNAL.definition: An internal video memory management issue occurred, often related to graphics drivers or hardware.
VIDEO_MEMORY_MANAGEMENT_INTERNAL.solution: Update graphics drivers, check the GPU for hardware issues, and ensure video memory is properly allocated.

RESOURCE_MANAGER_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED.definition: A resource manager exception was thrown but not handled, typically indicating a system-level error or driver issue.
RESOURCE_MANAGER_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED.solution: Check for driver updates, especially for hardware resource management, and run system diagnostics.

RECURSIVE_NMI.definition: A non-maskable interrupt (NMI) occurred recursively, which could indicate a hardware fault.
RECURSIVE_NMI.solution: Check for hardware failures, such as faulty CPU or memory, and replace malfunctioning components.

MSRPC_STATE_VIOLATION.definition: A violation in the state of Microsoft RPC (Remote Procedure Call) occurred, often due to communication issues.
MSRPC_STATE_VIOLATION.solution: Check RPC settings and configurations, and ensure that network communication is stable.

AGP_INTERNAL.definition: An internal error occurred in the Accelerated Graphics Port (AGP) driver.
AGP_INTERNAL.solution: Update the AGP driver, check for hardware issues, and ensure that the graphics card is properly seated.

VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE.definition: The Timeout Detection and Recovery (TDR) feature failed to recover from a video timeout.
VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE.solution: Update video drivers, check for overheating issues, and ensure proper cooling for the GPU.

VIDEO_TDR_TIMEOUT_DETECTED.definition: A video timeout was detected, leading to the failure of the TDR mechanism.
VIDEO_TDR_TIMEOUT_DETECTED.solution: Update GPU drivers, ensure proper system cooling, and check for hardware malfunctions in the video card.

VIDEO_SCHEDULER_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error was detected in the video scheduler, often related to GPU hardware or driver issues.
VIDEO_SCHEDULER_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Update or reinstall GPU drivers. Check the GPU hardware for potential issues.

EM_INITIALIZATION_FAILURE.definition: The system failed to initialize the emergency manager (EM) due to a corruption or configuration error.
EM_INITIALIZATION_FAILURE.solution: Check for corrupted system files and update drivers. Run a system file checker (sfc /scannow).

DRIVER_RETURNED_HOLDING_CANCEL_LOCK.definition: A driver improperly returned after holding a cancel lock, potentially causing system instability.
DRIVER_RETURNED_HOLDING_CANCEL_LOCK.solution: Update the affected drivers and check for hardware or driver conflicts.

ATTEMPTED_WRITE_TO_CM_PROTECTED_STORAGE.definition: The system attempted to write to protected system storage, which is restricted for security reasons.
ATTEMPTED_WRITE_TO_CM_PROTECTED_STORAGE.solution: Check for malicious software or security breaches, and ensure that the system's security settings are intact.

EVENT_TRACING_FATAL_ERROR.definition: An error occurred with event tracing, possibly related to system logs or kernel events.
EVENT_TRACING_FATAL_ERROR.solution: Check event logs for clues about the error. Ensure that the tracing drivers and logs are configured correctly.

TOO_MANY_RECURSIVE_FAULTS.definition: A recursive fault occurred too many times, potentially due to an issue with system-level fault handling or drivers.
TOO_MANY_RECURSIVE_FAULTS.solution: Update the system's drivers and software to address recursive faults. Run memory diagnostics to rule out hardware issues.

INVALID_DRIVER_HANDLE.definition: The system encountered an invalid driver handle, causing a crash or system instability.
INVALID_DRIVER_HANDLE.solution: Reinstall or update the driver causing the issue. Ensure the driver handle is properly initialized.

BITLOCKER_FATAL_ERROR.definition: A critical BitLocker error occurred, possibly due to disk corruption or a failed encryption process.
BITLOCKER_FATAL_ERROR.solution: Check disk health, ensure proper BitLocker configuration, and attempt to decrypt the disk if necessary.

DRIVER_VIOLATION.definition: A driver violated system rules or caused corruption, resulting in an exception.
DRIVER_VIOLATION.solution: Update the driver causing the issue, and check for incompatibilities with other installed software.

WHEA_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: A hardware error was detected by the Windows Hardware Error Architecture (WHEA), indicating a potential failure of the CPU, RAM, or other critical hardware.
WHEA_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Check hardware components for failure, run diagnostics, and check for overheating or faulty hardware.

CRYPTO_SELF_TEST_FAILURE.definition: The system failed a cryptographic self-test, indicating possible corruption in security settings or software.
CRYPTO_SELF_TEST_FAILURE.solution: Reconfigure security software and check for corruption in encryption settings or certificate stores.

WHEA_UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR.definition: An uncorrectable hardware error occurred, typically involving the CPU or memory.
WHEA_UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR.solution: Perform hardware diagnostics, check for overheating, and test the CPU and memory for defects.

NMR_INVALID_STATE.definition: A network-related error occurred due to an invalid state within the network resource manager (NMR).
NMR_INVALID_STATE.solution: Update network drivers, check network configurations, and ensure that the network stack is functioning correctly.

NETIO_INVALID_POOL_CALLER.definition: A pool-based error occurred within the network input/output (NETIO) stack, typically related to invalid calls to memory pool functions.
NETIO_INVALID_POOL_CALLER.solution: Update network drivers and check for issues with memory allocation or pool management in network components.

PAGE_NOT_ZERO.definition: A page of memory that was expected to be zero was found to contain non-zero data, which can cause system instability or crashes.
PAGE_NOT_ZERO.solution: Run memory diagnostics and verify the integrity of system files using the sfc /scannow command.

WORKER_THREAD_RETURNED_WITH_BAD_IO_PRIOR.definition: A worker thread returned with an invalid input/output priority, causing system instability.
WORKER_THREAD_RETURNED_WITH_BAD_IO_PRIOR.solution: Check thread scheduling code and ensure proper I/O priorities are assigned to worker threads.

WORKER_THREAD_RETURNED_WITH_BAD_PAGING_I.definition: A worker thread returned with an invalid paging I/O priority, leading to performance issues or crashes.
WORKER_THREAD_RETURNED_WITH_BAD_PAGING_I.solution: Review memory paging settings and ensure proper I/O prioritization in worker threads.

MUI_NO_VALID_SYSTEM_LANGUAGE.definition: The system encountered an error due to the absence of a valid language configuration.
MUI_NO_VALID_SYSTEM_LANGUAGE.solution: Configure the system's default language and region settings correctly. Reinstall any missing language packs.

FAULTY_HARDWARE_CORRUPTED_PAGE.definition: Faulty hardware caused page corruption, which may be due to defective RAM or other system components.
FAULTY_HARDWARE_CORRUPTED_PAGE.solution: Test hardware components like RAM for defects, run memory diagnostics, and replace faulty hardware if necessary.

EXFAT_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: An error occurred in the EXFAT file system, typically related to corrupt or damaged file systems.
EXFAT_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Run a disk check on the affected volume, and repair the file system using appropriate tools.

VOLSNAP_OVERLAPPED_TABLE_ACCESS.definition: An error occurred while accessing the volume snapshot table, potentially due to corruption or conflicts with other processes.
VOLSNAP_OVERLAPPED_TABLE_ACCESS.solution: Check for disk errors, update storage drivers, and ensure that no processes are interfering with snapshot management.

INVALID_MDL_RANGE.definition: The system attempted to access an invalid memory descriptor list (MDL) range.
INVALID_MDL_RANGE.solution: Check memory allocations, ensure proper range handling in memory management, and update drivers as necessary.

VHD_BOOT_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.definition: The system failed to initialize a Virtual Hard Disk (VHD) during boot.
VHD_BOOT_INITIALIZATION_FAILED.solution: Ensure that the VHD is correctly configured and accessible. Check virtual disk settings and boot configuration.

DYNAMIC_ADD_PROCESSOR_MISMATCH.definition: The system encountered an issue when dynamically adding a processor, possibly due to an architecture mismatch.
DYNAMIC_ADD_PROCESSOR_MISMATCH.solution: Check CPU compatibility and ensure that all processors are properly supported by the operating system.

INVALID_EXTENDED_PROCESSOR_STATE.definition: The processor entered an invalid extended state, which could be related to misconfigured system settings or hardware failure.
INVALID_EXTENDED_PROCESSOR_STATE.solution: Check for CPU or system board issues, and update the BIOS or processor drivers.

RESOURCE_OWNER_POINTER_INVALID.definition: An invalid resource owner pointer was encountered, typically indicating a failure in memory or resource management.
RESOURCE_OWNER_POINTER_INVALID.solution: Ensure proper memory allocation and resource management, and check for memory leaks or corruption.

DPC_WATCHDOG_VIOLATION.definition: A Deferred Procedure Call (DPC) took too long to complete, potentially indicating a driver or hardware failure.
DPC_WATCHDOG_VIOLATION.solution: Update drivers, particularly for graphics and network devices, and check for hardware failures.

DRIVE_EXTENDER.definition: An issue occurred with the Drive Extender system, which may be related to disk management or drive mirroring.
DRIVE_EXTENDER.solution: Check for issues with the storage array or RAID configuration. Run disk diagnostics.

REGISTRY_FILTER_DRIVER_EXCEPTION.definition: A registry filter driver caused an exception during execution, potentially due to corruption or a driver conflict.
REGISTRY_FILTER_DRIVER_EXCEPTION.solution: Check for corrupted registry entries and update or reinstall filter drivers as needed.

VHD_BOOT_HOST_VOLUME_NOT_ENOUGH_SPACE.definition: The boot process failed due to insufficient space on the host volume for a Virtual Hard Disk.
VHD_BOOT_HOST_VOLUME_NOT_ENOUGH_SPACE.solution: Ensure adequate free space on the host volume. Consider resizing the virtual disk or freeing up space.

WIN32K_HANDLE_MANAGER.definition: An error occurred within the Win32k system's handle manager, potentially causing display or UI issues.
WIN32K_HANDLE_MANAGER.solution: Update display drivers and check for conflicts in the Win32k subsystem.

GPIO_CONTROLLER_DRIVER_ERROR.definition: An error was encountered with the GPIO controller driver, typically indicating hardware or driver issues.
GPIO_CONTROLLER_DRIVER_ERROR.solution: Update the GPIO controller driver, check for hardware malfunctions, and verify proper pin configurations.

KERNEL_SECURITY_CHECK_FAILURE.definition: This error occurs when the kernel detects a security integrity violation, such as corruption in memory or invalid system state.
KERNEL_SECURITY_CHECK_FAILURE.solution: Run a system file checker (sfc /scannow), update all drivers, and check for malware that may have compromised system security.

KERNEL_MODE_HEAP_CORRUPTION.definition: The kernel detected heap corruption in kernel mode, which may lead to instability or crashes.
KERNEL_MODE_HEAP_CORRUPTION.solution: Update the device drivers and ensure that memory allocation functions are correctly implemented. Run memory diagnostics.

PASSIVE_INTERRUPT_ERROR.definition: This error is caused by improper handling of interrupt routines, typically when interrupts occur during a passive level of the processor.
PASSIVE_INTERRUPT_ERROR.solution: Check for hardware driver issues and update or reinstall any drivers related to interrupt management.

INVALID_IO_BOOST_STATE.definition: An invalid state was detected when boosting I/O operations, which can affect system performance and stability.
INVALID_IO_BOOST_STATE.solution: Verify power management settings and update drivers related to input/output (I/O) operations.

CRITICAL_INITIALIZATION_FAILURE.definition: A critical system component failed to initialize, likely during boot or system startup.
CRITICAL_INITIALIZATION_FAILURE.solution: Check for corrupted system files, run startup repair, and reinstall critical system drivers.

STORAGE_DEVICE_ABNORMALITY_DETECTED.definition: The system detected an issue with a storage device, such as a hard drive or SSD, which may indicate hardware failure.
STORAGE_DEVICE_ABNORMALITY_DETECTED.solution: Run a disk check (chkdsk), test the storage device with manufacturer tools, and replace the device if necessary.

PROCESSOR_DRIVER_INTERNAL.definition: An internal error occurred within the processor driver, which may cause system instability or crashes.
PROCESSOR_DRIVER_INTERNAL.solution: Update the processor driver and BIOS/UEFI firmware. Check for hardware compatibility issues.

BUGCODE_USB3_DRIVER.definition: An issue was detected with the USB 3.0 driver, which could cause system crashes or failures when interacting with USB devices.
BUGCODE_USB3_DRIVER.solution: Update USB drivers and firmware. Disconnect and reconnect USB devices, and check for hardware issues.

SECURE_BOOT_VIOLATION.definition: A secure boot violation occurred, which may happen if the system attempts to boot using unsigned or corrupted boot files.
SECURE_BOOT_VIOLATION.solution: Ensure that Secure Boot is properly configured in the BIOS/UEFI. Restore or replace any corrupt boot files.

ABNORMAL_RESET_DETECTED.definition: The system detected an abnormal reset, which could be caused by hardware issues, overclocking, or power fluctuations.
ABNORMAL_RESET_DETECTED.solution: Check the system's power supply and hardware components. Revert any overclocking settings and test with default configurations.

REFS_FILE_SYSTEM.definition: The ReFS (Resilient File System) encountered an issue, which may lead to data corruption or an inability to read/write files.
REFS_FILE_SYSTEM.solution: Check for disk errors, ensure the ReFS driver is up to date, and run file system checks to repair any corruption.

KERNEL_WMI_INTERNAL.definition: A problem occurred with the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI), possibly due to driver or system misconfigurations.
KERNEL_WMI_INTERNAL.solution: Update or repair the WMI components and related drivers. Run WMI diagnostic tools to resolve issues.

SOC_SUBSYSTEM_FAILURE.definition: A failure occurred in the System on Chip (SOC) subsystem, which could affect the overall performance of embedded systems or devices.
SOC_SUBSYSTEM_FAILURE.solution: Check for hardware compatibility and update the firmware for the SOC. Test the system in a different environment if possible.

FATAL_ABNORMAL_RESET_ERROR.definition: A fatal error occurred due to an abnormal reset, indicating a severe hardware failure or critical system problem.
FATAL_ABNORMAL_RESET_ERROR.solution: Inspect hardware components for failure. Perform diagnostics on the CPU, motherboard, and power supply.

EXCEPTION_SCOPE_INVALID.definition: The system detected an invalid exception scope, indicating that an exception was thrown outside the valid range of execution.
EXCEPTION_SCOPE_INVALID.solution: Debug the system code to identify improper exception handling. Ensure all exception scopes are defined correctly.

SOC_CRITICAL_DEVICE_REMOVED.definition: A critical device connected to the System on Chip (SOC) was removed, leading to a system crash or loss of functionality.
SOC_CRITICAL_DEVICE_REMOVED.solution: Check for loose or disconnected hardware components. Replace or reseat any critical devices connected to the SOC.

PDC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT.definition: A timeout occurred in the Processor Device Controller (PDC), which could indicate an issue with processor power management or communication.
PDC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT.solution: Update processor and chipset drivers. Check for power management issues or conflicts.

TCPIP_AOAC_NIC_ACTIVE_REFERENCE_LEAK.definition: A memory leak was detected in the TCP/IP stack, related to the Always-On, Always-Connected (AOAC) network interface controller (NIC).
TCPIP_AOAC_NIC_ACTIVE_REFERENCE_LEAK.solution: Update network drivers and troubleshoot any application that might be causing improper resource handling in the NIC.

UNSUPPORTED_INSTRUCTION_MODE.definition: The system attempted to run an unsupported instruction mode, potentially due to incompatible hardware or software.
UNSUPPORTED_INSTRUCTION_MODE.solution: Verify hardware compatibility and ensure the correct processor instruction set is being used by the operating system.

INVALID_PUSH_LOCK_FLAGS.definition: Invalid flags were used with a push lock operation, which could indicate a synchronization issue in multi-threaded applications.
INVALID_PUSH_LOCK_FLAGS.solution: Check synchronization code and ensure proper flags are being used with push locks.

KERNEL_LOCK_ENTRY_LEAKED_ON_THREAD_TERMI.definition: A lock entry was not released when a thread terminated, causing a resource leak in kernel mode.
KERNEL_LOCK_ENTRY_LEAKED_ON_THREAD_TERMI.solution: Ensure that all kernel-level resources are released properly when threads terminate.

UNEXPECTED_STORE_EXCEPTION.definition: An unexpected exception occurred while handling a store operation, possibly related to memory or data storage issues.
UNEXPECTED_STORE_EXCEPTION.solution: Run memory diagnostics and check disk health. Update storage drivers to fix potential compatibility issues.

OS_DATA_TAMPERING.definition: The operating system detected data tampering, which may be the result of malicious activity or file corruption.
OS_DATA_TAMPERING.solution: Run a full system scan for malware and verify the integrity of system files. Apply security patches and updates.

KERNEL_THREAD_PRIORITY_FLOOR_VIOLATION.definition: A violation occurred in kernel thread priority management, causing improper scheduling of threads.
KERNEL_THREAD_PRIORITY_FLOOR_VIOLATION.solution: Check and adjust the thread priority management settings. Ensure that critical threads are scheduled properly in the kernel.

ILLEGAL_IOMMU_PAGE_FAULT.definition: An illegal page fault occurred in the I/O Memory Management Unit (IOMMU), which could lead to data corruption or system crashes.
ILLEGAL_IOMMU_PAGE_FAULT.solution: Update chipset and storage drivers. Test the memory for defects and verify IOMMU settings in the BIOS/UEFI.

HAL_ILLEGAL_IOMMU_PAGE_FAULT.definition: A hardware abstraction layer (HAL) detected an illegal page fault in the IOMMU, typically caused by hardware issues.
HAL_ILLEGAL_IOMMU_PAGE_FAULT.solution: Update system firmware and drivers. Run hardware diagnostics on the memory and motherboard.

SDBUS_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error was detected in the SD bus driver, possibly due to hardware malfunctions or driver corruption.
SDBUS_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Update SD card drivers and firmware. Check the SD bus for hardware issues or conflicts.

WORKER_THREAD_RETURNED_WITH_SYSTEM_PAGE_.definition: A worker thread returned while the system page priority was still active, leading to a potential race condition or memory inconsistency.
WORKER_THREAD_RETURNED_WITH_SYSTEM_PAGE_.solution: Review thread scheduling code and ensure that page priority is properly handled before threads are terminated.

WIN32K_ATOMIC_CHECK_FAILURE.definition: An atomic check failure occurred in the Win32k subsystem, which handles user interface and window management.
WIN32K_ATOMIC_CHECK_FAILURE.solution: Update or reinstall display drivers and check for software conflicts with the Win32k system components.

KERNEL_AUTO_BOOST_INVALID_LOCK_RELEASE.definition: An invalid lock release occurred during the kernel auto-boost process, leading to system instability.
KERNEL_AUTO_BOOST_INVALID_LOCK_RELEASE.solution: Ensure proper lock management in kernel code and check for conflicts in boost or resource allocation mechanisms.

WORKER_THREAD_TEST_CONDITION.definition: A worker thread encountered a test condition that led to an unexpected termination or failure.
WORKER_THREAD_TEST_CONDITION.solution: Review thread logic and ensure that all conditions are properly handled in multi-threaded applications.

WIN32K_CRITICAL_FAILURE.definition: A critical failure occurred within the Win32k subsystem, which could cause system crashes or UI issues.
WIN32K_CRITICAL_FAILURE.solution: Check for hardware or driver conflicts, particularly related to graphics or display functionality.

INVALID_RUNDOWN_PROTECTION_FLAGS.definition: Invalid flags were used with rundown protection, which manages cleanup of resources in kernel-level threads.
INVALID_RUNDOWN_PROTECTION_FLAGS.solution: Review the code that manages rundown protection and ensure proper flags are used for resource cleanup.

INVALID_SLOT_ALLOCATOR_FLAGS.definition: An error occurred in the slot allocator due to invalid flags, potentially caused by driver or system misconfiguration.
INVALID_SLOT_ALLOCATOR_FLAGS.solution: Check for updates to device drivers, particularly those that manage memory or resources. Reconfigure the system settings if necessary.

ERESOURCE_INVALID_RELEASE.definition: An error occurred when releasing a resource, indicating that the resource was not properly allocated or managed.
ERESOURCE_INVALID_RELEASE.solution: Ensure that resources are allocated and released properly in drivers or applications. Debug and update faulty driver code if applicable.

CLUSTER_CSV_CLUSSVC_DISCONNECT_WATCHDOG.definition: The Cluster Shared Volumes (CSV) service failed to connect or communicate, leading to a watchdog timeout.
CLUSTER_CSV_CLUSSVC_DISCONNECT_WATCHDOG.solution: Verify the network and storage configuration for CSV, and check the Cluster service logs for potential connectivity issues. Update any relevant drivers.

CRYPTO_LIBRARY_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error occurred in the cryptography library, possibly related to encryption or decryption operations.
CRYPTO_LIBRARY_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Check for updates or corruption in system cryptographic libraries. Run a system file check and update security software.

COREMSGCALL_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error was detected during a Core Message Call, possibly related to inter-process communication.
COREMSGCALL_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Ensure that the system message services are working correctly. Update system components responsible for message handling or inter-process communication.

COREMSG_INTERNAL_ERROR.definition: An internal error in the core message system, indicating a failure in system communication or message passing.
COREMSG_INTERNAL_ERROR.solution: Diagnose the message handling service. Look for driver or hardware conflicts that may be disrupting system communication.

ELAM_DRIVER_DETECTED_FATAL_ERROR.definition: A fatal error was detected in the Early Launch Anti-malware (ELAM) driver, possibly due to a malware or software conflict.
ELAM_DRIVER_DETECTED_FATAL_ERROR.solution: Ensure ELAM and antivirus software are up-to-date. Perform a full system scan to rule out malware interference.

PROFILER_CONFIGURATION_ILLEGAL.definition: The profiler configuration was found to be illegal or invalid, preventing proper performance monitoring.
PROFILER_CONFIGURATION_ILLEGAL.solution: Reconfigure the profiler settings and ensure that performance monitoring tools are compatible with the current system configuration.
